column4: hey, i accidently screwed up my gnome, somehow the top bar ended up on the right, and i can't move it back to the top for some reason, any ideas why?
it's because you can't grab taht thing with the mouse.
can i do it manually then?
I really can't help you there, I'm not that brave
hang on a sec, I'll tell you where, I did that myself
lol, figured it was for me
in the left panel, expand apps to /apps/panel/toplevels/top_panel_screen0, and change, in the right panel, orientation back to top
np, it is ugeley, isn't it
any idea what might cause xorg to not accept the alt key in alt+ctrl+f#    i have to use the sysRQ hot keys to reset the keyboard before i can break out of x    ?
no clue, never had that problem before
no one active at the moment anyway.
yeah.   it is deceptive, all the idlers
yeah, have you tried both alt keys?
google doesn't say much in english ;(
